ratings.comment:
It is easy to follow him through lecture with the concepts and calculations, but doing the actual homework for some reason was harder. Tests were tough. Discussion Section and TA were helpful.
Wish I would have taken Econ 101 before this: it probably would have helped me understand the material better.

This was an Excel Modeling Class. While the material was useful and I did learn a lot, this professor is awful. He provides very little help to students and frequently does not respond to questions. One would think that being a professor for an online class would make you approachable, but this professor is very hard to reach.

I respect Brian Gould a lot, but his lectures and his course format was extremely difficult to follow. I will however give him credit for assisting me through the second half of the semester after I tanked the first exam.
Extremely disorganized, unhelpful. His assignments do not make any sense. Bad professor. Won't recommend anyone to take a class with him.

Disorganized at best. Does not hold himself to the same standard as students, making mistake after mistake in conducting lectures and creating assigned homework. Difficult to follow whether you're working on an assignment, or listening to a lecture.

Bad, boring lecture, he made really stupid mistakes and didn't realize. A lot of difficult homework and even if you go to his office hours he won't really help you. Had homework due the night before thanksgiving and during final week while he himself disappeared. Exams were very difficult and made no sense. Words can't describe how horrible he was.
Words can't describe how horrible he was.

It's really a business Excel class. Lectures are boring and attendance is taken through the TopHat app. Homework is challenging; tests are very, very hard. You have to slug like crazy but you become very good at Excel by the end of it. A must-take class that'll genuinely help you get employed.

One of my most important college classes, but very difficult. The homework is almost all excel based.  Prof Gould will help you, but theoretically, not much in excel. You spend at least 6 hours a week on homework, but at least 60% of your grade is 2 LONG tests. If you keep up on the homework and meet with him, you'll be okay, but don't fall behind.

He is very interested on dairy stuffs. He always present current data that are related to course content. Lecture notes are helpful. Sometimes he made mistakes in slides and while explaining concepts, but excusable. Tests are tricky and quite hard. Workload is quite light.
